text:
The first time I've heard about ski freeride I was 16 years old and I was not as good at ski as today. But now I've been skying every year I've been more intrested by this sport. So I started to watch the Free ride World tour, the biggest competition of ski freeride. So I've watched Alex Dupont or Alex Dupont (famous french freeriders) and I've been quickly impressed by this sport and by them. This discipline is very particular because it's dangerous, amazing, bluffing, hard to do, so this is why it's unique. It's also an extreme sport because of the fact that every run you do could be the last one because Mountains are dangerous and unpredictable so at every moment, during a run an avalanch can appear. Moreover, the injuries can be very serious if you fall.
When you are intrested by a sport you try to do the same but at differents levels. So once, I've tried to do an off pist to do the same that they do, skiing deep in the snow, without any people on the pist, the sensations are not the sames.
The extreme sport is limit test of the body, with others words, it's adrenaline. To watch this is very satisfactory, images are beautiful with great landscapes. Riders are doing amazing tricks. The most famous freerider is Alex Dupont, he's just unbelievable in what he does, he jumps further away than everybody, he does tricks that no one can do, he go faster etc.
For many years this sport was unknown by people but now that people go on youtube or internet easier they can watch this even if it's not on purpose, you just heard about something incredible that has been done and you check it out. This extreme sport is a modjo for those freeriders, they eat ski, they sleep ski and they live ski. When it's summer they just go on the otherside of the globe where there is snow on mountains and they continue to ski. Or another alternative is continu tu ride but on a skateboard or on a surfboard but they never stop ride.
 Done above
